description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Transfer of Power, Quenching the Fire, and a Smoky Protest

description: The 32-year-old man is set to face a number of charges in court after police allege he was involved in the 3D printing of firearms.
title: Man Charged After Police Uncover 3D Printed Firearm Manufacturing Operation

description: Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland isn’t showing signs of worry that the U.S. can now launch a trade challenge against the Liberal government’s controversial digital services tax. The Liberals are slapping a three-per-cent tax on the Canadian revenues of digital giants, which will affect major U.S. tech companies such as Google and Apple. The U.S. government […]
title: Freeland Finds Safety in Numbers on Digital Sales Tax

description: The evidence from two secret witnesses with first-hand knowledge about China meddling in Canada’s democracy will be recorded via affidavits, the Hogue Commission said in a decision that notes the information will be sealed with the exception of summaries produced for public release. Commissioner Marie-Josée Hogue issued her decision Nov. 13 regarding the two potential […]
title: First-Hand Accounts of Beijing’s Interference With Politicians to Be Sealed for 99 Years: Hogue Commission

description: 'China ... is now more a competitor and a systemic rival: Our dependencies toward China in the key sectors are our vulnerability,' Kaja Kallas said.
title: EU’s Incoming Foreign Policy Chief Signals Bold Stance on China

description: Canada’s Public Health Agency has confirmed that a British Columbia teenager hospitalized last Friday is the country’s first ever human case of domestically acquired avian flu. The agency says in a statement that testing at Canada’s National Microbiology Laboratory in Winnipeg confirms the teen did contract the H5N1 avian flu, the same strain related to […]
title: Lab Confirms Canada’s First Case of Avian Flu Infection in Humans in BC

description: The Biden administration intends to intensify U.S. military aid to Ukraine in a bid to counter Russia's invasion through 2025, the U.S. Secretary of State said.
title: Blinken Vows US Military Aid Surge to Support Ukraine in 2025 Fight Against Russia

description: Via Rail is asking for a judicial review on the reasons why Canadian National Railway Co. has imposed speed restrictions on its new passenger trains. The Crown corporation says it is seeking the review from the Federal Court after many attempts at dialogue with the company did not yield valid reasoning for the change. It […]
title: Via Rail Seeks Judicial Review on CN’s Speed Restrictions

description: Two Ottawa minors facing terrorism charges were allegedly plotting an attack on a pro-Israel rally on Parliament Hill before their arrests, according to a media report. The first youth arrested by the RCMP last December was charged with instructing others to carry out terrorist activities and sharing instructions related to explosive materials, and was later […]
title: Ottawa Teens Accused of Plotting Attack on Pro-Israel Rally on Parliament Hill: Report

description: A Halifax law firm says a $2.1-million settlement has been proposed in a class action filed against Dell Canada and its parent company Dell USA. Wagners revealed Wednesday the proposed settlement in the case it has been pursuing on behalf of thousands of Canadians whose personal information was compromised during a breach of a service […]
title: $2.1M Settlement Proposed in Class Action Against Dell Over Data Breaches, Scam Calls

description: The selection signals a tough approach by the incoming Trump administration toward international diplomacy.
title: Trump Picks Rubio, Longtime China Hawk, for Secretary of State

description: The man President-elect Donald Trump has tapped to clamp down on illegal immigration has a personal connection to the U.S. northern border and he intends to harden it to protect against what he calls significant national security threats. Trump announced on Nov. 11 that former Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) acting director Tom Homan will […]
title: ‘National Security Vulnerability’: Trump’s Border Czar Promises to Harden Border With Canada

description: Canada Post has responded to a potential strike threat from its postal workers by delivering a lockout notice to the union that represents them. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers (CUPW) says the Nov. 12 notice from Canada Post indicates postal workers will be locked out as of 8 a.m. on Nov. 15 unless agreements […]
title: Lockout Notice Issued by Canada Post Following Union’s Strike Threat

description: The leaked files detailed Israel's military preparations for a retaliatory strike on Iran.
title: Federal Employee With Top Secret Clearance Charged for Leaking Classified Files About Israel

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is travelling to Bermuda today to give a eulogy at the funeral for businessman Peter Green. Green was a lifelong family friend to Trudeau and, as reported by the National Post, his family owns a luxury estate in Jamaica where Trudeau has stayed at no cost. Trudeau’s last holiday trip to […]
title: Prime Minister Trudeau Makes Trip to Bermuda to Eulogize Longtime Family Friend

description: Labour's Bill to abolish hereditary peers passes second reading in Parliament, but a Conservative MP's amendment to remove clerics was voted down.
title: Tory Move to Banish Bishops From House of Lords Defeated

description: President Joe Biden plans to meet with Chinese leader Xi Jinping at the APEC summit in Peru on Nov. 16.
title: Biden, Xi to Hold Bilateral Meeting at APEC Summit This Week

description: Mounties in B.C. say they’ve arrested three men in Surrey believed to be tied to a transnational organized crime group connected to Mexican drug cartels, while four others suspected of trafficking large quantities of drugs, including diverted prescription pills, were arrested in Burnaby. RCMP federal investigators say that on Sept. 23, police searched a Surrey […]
title: RCMP Say Three Men Arrested in BC Have Ties to Mexican Drug Cartels

description: A Canada-wide arrest warrant has been issued for an Edmonton woman charged in connection with a violent road rage assault in British Columbia’s Lower Mainland that hospitalized a young couple earlier this fall. Authorities in B.C. and Alberta are joining forces to locate 35-year-old Amber Jenelle Toews, one of two suspects believed to be involved […]
title: Efforts Ramp Up to Find Woman Wanted in BC Road Rage Assault That Left Couple Hospitalized

description: The health secretary said he would 'hate for people to opt for assisted dying because they think they’re saving someone somewhere … money.'
title: Streeting Orders Cost Review of Assisted Suicide

description: The USS Stockdale and USS Spruance intercepted eight missiles and eight one-way attack drones launched from Houthi-controlled areas of Yemen on Nov. 11.
title: 2 US Warships Repel Houthi Drone and Missile Attacks, Pentagon Confirms

description: Shortly before his visit to Tehran, Rafael Grossi said that the IAEA is in the dark about Iran's nuclear program.
title: IAEA Chief Grossi Heads to Iran for Crunch Talks Over Nuclear Program

description: The two companies will work together to create new electric vehicle architecture and software for future models.
title: Volkswagen’s Investment in Venture With EV Maker Rivian Rises to $5.8 Billion

description: The government announcement follows a ban on zombie-style knives and machetes enforced in September.
title: Tech Execs Could Be Held Liable for Failing to Remove Illegal Knife Ads

description: U.S. Attorney Damian Williams said the two men abused their positions in Somalia’s government over their roles in the journalist’s kidnapping.
title: Somali Men Get 30 Years in Prison for Holding US Journalist Captive

description: Moscow and Pyongyang have neither confirmed nor denied the presence of North Korean troops in the Russian border region.
title: North Korean Troops Actively Fighting Ukrainian Forces in Russia’s Kursk, Says Washington

description: Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki volcano's eruption earlier this month has also prompted mass evacuations.
title: Major Airlines Cancel Flights to Indonesia’s Bali After Volcanic Eruption

description: Double the usual number of officers are being deployed by police in the French capital in an effort to avoid similar scenes to those in Amsterdam last week.
title: Paris Beefs Up Security Ahead of France v Israel Football Match

description: Ontario will invest nearly $5 million in the development of a new crane training facility, aiming to help address the workforce shortage in skilled trades and support ongoing construction across the province. The provincial money will help fund a $25 million training centre in Oro-Medonte, 90 minutes north of Toronto, which will be led by […]
title: Ontario Pledges $5M for Crane Training Facility in Oro-Medonte

description: The military drills are part of a trilateral exercise known as 'Freedom Edge.'
title: US Holds Military Drills With South Korea, Japan as North Korean Troops Begin Training With Russian Forces

description: The overhaul of Post Office operations includes plans for a lower-risk IT system for postmasters.
title: 115 Post Office Branches at Risk of Closure Under Transformation Plan

description: Trailing far behind Germany's center-right CDU/CSU and AfD, Scholz's SPD faces an uphill battle as snap elections loom amid a struggling economy.
title: Polls Suggest Defeat for Scholz as Germany Faces Snap Election

description: Health Secretary Wes Streeting sets out new proposals to drive down NHS waiting times and boost performance but health bosses warn move could demoralise staff.
title: Failing Hospital Trusts to Be ‘Named and Shamed’ in League Tables

description: The Japanese owner of 7-Eleven says it has received a new management buyout proposal from a member of the family that helped found the company. The proposal for Seven & i Holdings Co. Ltd. by Junro Ito, who is a vice-president and director of the company, and his private company Ito-Kogyo Co. Ltd. follows an […]
title: Japanese Owner of 7-Eleven Receives Another Offer to Rival Couche-Tard Bid

description: Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland says the Canada carbon rebate for small businesses will be tax-free. In a statement posted to X late Tuesday, Freeland clarified the parameters of the program after an advocacy group for small business raised concerns that the rebate would be a taxable benefit. Dan Kelly, president and […]
title: Chrystia Freeland Says Carbon Rebate for Small Businesses Will Be Tax-Free

description: John Swinney said central government must commit to undertaking impact assessments on its budget proposals on farmers in Scotland.
title: Inheritance Tax Having ‘Chilling Effect’ on Scottish Farmers, Says First Minister

description: The new prime minister Navin Ramgoolam, 77, has said he will dismantle the country's 'spying system so that Mauritians will be free to talk.'
title: Landslide Defeat For Ruling Party In Mauritius After Phone Calls Leaked On TikTok

description: Government funding to offset tax hikes doesn’t cover private sector firms contracted out with GPs, generally operating as independent businesses.
title: Tax Hikes Could Lead to GP Closures, Union Warns Health Secretary

description: In an attempt to tackle low productivity growth, Jim Chalmers is offering up to $900 million to states and territories to help them improve.
title: Treasurer Hopes to Lift Australia’s Productivity With $900 Million Fund

description: Take home sales have gone up with supermarkets seeing the biggest spending month of the year so far, reaching £11.6 billion in October.
title: Grocery Price Inflation Rises, Say Data Analysts

description: The U.S State Department said Israel has made some progress in improving aid flow to Gaza but relief groups say conditions in Gaza have worsened.
title: US Will Not Limit Israel Arms Transfers After Gaza Aid Deadline Passes

description: The Australian government and opposition have moved to assuage concerns about a second Trump presidency.
title: UN Failing to Maintain Global Peace: Shadow Minister Warns Against ‘Catastrophising’ Trump Election

description: Roger Cook is seeking legal advice to see whether he can change the date of the state election, which could run at the same time as the federal poll.
title: Australian Premier Seeks Vote Delay Amid Falling Labor Support

description: MANSEHRA, Pakistan—A bus carrying about two dozen wedding guests fell into the Indus River in northern Pakistan on Tuesday, killing at least 18 people, officials said. It happened in the Gilgit Baltistan region as the bus was heading to Chakwal, a city in Punjab province, government spokesman Faizullah Faraq said. He said so far only […]
title: Bus Carrying Wedding Guests Falls Into River in Northern Pakistan, Killing 18

description: One Nation Senator Pauline Hanson was found to have racially discriminated against Greens Senator Mehreen Faruqi.
title: Senator Raises Half a Million Dollars to Appeal Racial Discrimination Ruling

description: A domestic gas producer has slammed the risk to investment and the nation’s energy supply from green tape and a “minority of activists with extreme views.” Media boss Ryan Stokes, speaking on Wednesday as chair of oil and gas producer Beach Energy, said there were still “significant headwinds” facing the energy industry despite some progress […]
title: Gas Producer Slams Ideological Folly, Warns of Shortage

description: As protesters march from the top of the North Island and bottom of the South to meet in Wellington, their numbers are growing, causing disruption.
title: Protesters Block Auckland Harbour Bridge, March Against Bill Seeking to Repeal Unique Indigenous Rights

description: Treasury Secretary Steven Kennedy rejected Greens' proposal of changing negative gearing and capital gain tax discounts to address the housing crisis.
title: Government Should ‘Firmly’ Focus on Boosting Housing Supplies: Treasury Secretary

description: Toronto police arrested 23 people and seized 16 firearms in connection with a “brazen” night-time shooting in the city’s west end on Nov. 11. Police were in the area of Queen Street W. and Sudbury Street for an unrelated investigation at around 11:20 p.m. when three people who arrived in a stolen vehicle opened fire […]
title: Toronto Police Arrest 23 as Nearly 100 Shots Fired in ‘Brazen’ Gun Battle Damage Police Car

description: The Ottawa-Carleton District School Board (OCDSB) says it will conduct a “thorough investigation” into reports that a local school used a Palestinian protest song in its Remembrance Day ceremonies on Nov. 11. Sir Robert Borden High School allegedly played “Haza Salam” in Arabic during its ceremony. The song has become connected to protests about Israel […]
title: Ontario School Board Investigating High School’s Use of Palestinian Protest Song on Remembrance Day

description: Ontario Liberals have released a plan to cut taxes in the province if they win the next election. Liberal Leader Bonnie Crombie made the announcement at a press conference in Scarborough on Nov. 12. “This will be the largest tax relief for the people of Ontario in over a decade,” Crombie said. The Liberal plan […]
title: Ontario Liberals Announce Tax Cuts as Part of Election Promise

description: A GIF of sand trickling in an hourglass, posted with Rudd's statement on Trump’s win, suggests that Rudd's time is up.
title: Trump Senior Advisor Signals Time Is Ticking for Rudd’s Ambassador Role

description: The federal government has opened a research institute focused on studying the security risks posed by artificial intelligence. The Canadian Artificial Intelligence Safety Institute (CAISI) was created as part of the federal government’s broader strategy to address security risks associated with AI, including misuse in disinformation, cybersecurity breaches, and election interference, according to a Nov. […]
title: Ottawa Launches Research Institute on AI Security
